Temperature Measurement Instrumentation Standards
Introduction
Temperature measurement is fundamental to controlling reaction rates, product quality and equipment integrity in a refinery. These standards draw on API 551, ISA 20, ISA 5.1 and ASME PTC 19.3 requirements to ensure reliable and accurate temperature measurement devices.
Applicable Standards
API 551 – Process Measurement Instrumentation: temperature measurement guidelines.
ISA 5.1 – Instrumentation Symbols and Identification: P&ID symbols.
ISA 20 – Data Sheets: information to capture for temperature instruments.
ASME PTC 19.3 TW – Thermowell Design: rules for thermowell stress and vibration.
ASTM E1137/E1137M – Standard Specification for Industrial Platinum RTDs.
Equipment Types
Resistance Temperature Detectors (RTDs): spring‑loaded platinum RTDs with 316 SS thermowells; 4–20 mA transmitters with ±0.1 % of span accuracy【51948133245220†L3910-L3925】.
